reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2019
reviews.name: Abbie
reviews.title: Buyer beware; you're in for a rip off.
reviews.review: So, I did some research and bought this switch because it is advertised as the 'NEW' model with serial number beginning with 'XKW'. It is said to have better battery life, possibly a boosted processor, and generally just be an updated switch model. That being said, the old discontinued model still retails for the same amount. I checked my model on my 'NEW AND IMPROVED' switch, and it is the sane as my 2018 switch XAW. Needless to say, I am rather disappointed in Amazon. I installed all my games, transferred data, and now I am stuck with wiping and returning it or just settling for a mediocre version of the switch. Thanks for the annoyance Amazon! Also, the left Joy-con bumper was broken right out of the box! It was also covered in grease. $300 for outdated switch, and a broken controller. I don't normally leave nasty reviews, but I'm pretty bummed. Also nintendo will switch out the outdated one, but I have to ship it to them!

Whats with these prices for Nintendo Switchsystems ?——————————————————————-I came to understand that some store around my area have almost nothing shipped in and as well not taking any trade in. So supply and demand is the reason for raising the prices on these items(taking advantage in other words) Switch for $600.00 and if buying controllers there not $60 or $70 there any color$104.99... with the exception of maybe the grey joy-cons. AND DON'T LET THOSE PRICE GOUGERS TAKE YOUR MONEY!PATIENCE IS A VIRTUE! I was diligent for not even 48 hours and just kept checking and refreshing and eventually it paid off!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2020
reviews.name: Terrorgod
reviews.title: The switch is a unique console that has a lot of good ideas, but is poorly executed.
reviews.review: I have an loaded opinion on this console that I want to express. The Switch is flawed. As an avid gamer who usually ends up buying all the consoles (except the xbox one) and loves the hardware behind these machines, the switch was super cool when I first heard about it and saw it. I got one not to long after release once they came back to my area. Though it took awhile to save up for any games as during that point in its life, everything was expensive on it and 3rd party devs hadn't moved to it yet. Also there were no media apps on it besides hulu which somehow is still a thing, surprising. But that isn't what I want to talk about, its more how the switch feels really damn cheap.I don't mean cheap as with the plastic shell either (but that is an issue, dislike the texture a lot, and it was also damaged by strong adhesives from dbrand before), but you get a wimpy TN panel for its main built in display, in an era where amoled and ips are very obtainable for device of this size (the original psvita was oled, so it could have been possible). As the resolution is at a solid 720p, which can help balance good enough quality on the go with actual game performance, I feel like they should have opted for a nicer quality screen to have better range of colors, would have created more vivid scenes using sharper and brighter colors. Instead they chose washed out TN panels which leave a lot to be desired when comparing it to any handheld screen semi modern hand held screen with exception of DS's which also chose awful screens. (and some might argue TN for faster response time, and to that, I highly disagree with improvements to other display types, and also for the type of audience the switch aims at)Next I want to talk about the Joycons, as they are lovely little controllers that snap onto the side of the console with a satisfying click. I actually wouldn't have minded them despite being kinda awful when using them on a big screen if they worked correctly, but three years in and these things are still built to fail. There is a major design flaw in them that eventually has the analogue stick wear our and start "drifting", making the controller effectively useless. If these were cheap, maybe I wouldn't care as much, but they are 80$ to replace. Sure you can contact nintendo customer support and they sometimes take care of you, but this is a hassle and shouldn't even be a problem. They could have just owned up to the mistake, and redesigned the controllers at this point. ( pro controller is actually a solid design, but its more expensive then both ps4 and xbox one controllers so I dislike recommending it. I believe its the amiibo sensor that does this and that's just bad).Lastly, I kinda wanna just complain about nintendo being nintendo. But before that I want to praise them for how far they did come up to this point. There is finally 3rd party content being pushed on the Switch and thats awesome. It seems like they did listen a bit and made it much easier to get games on the Switch. Ok now onto the bad. The Switch has no utility, and I get that its a gaming console, but still its surprsing that the most mobile and potentially flexible console lacks basic OS features that things like the ps4, psvita, and even 3DS were capable of doing such as, have a variety of streaming services, a basic web browser, and customizing the layout of your home screen/having fun backgrounds. There is no personality to the switch despite it being one of the most unique consoles I have ever seen, which is quite baffling to me. Despite the console featuring bluetooth for its joycons and pro controller, you cant connect bluetooth headphones to it without a 3rd party adapter, which is a little baffling for an on the go console. The UI looks pretty ugly when put onto a big screen, just a personal gripe of mine, I really don't like it. Lastly, the game cartridges are a letdown. The reason games usually feel more expensive on the switch is because they more often then not are. This is due to the game cartridges costing more to make than blu-ray media for the other consoles. Nintendo also didn't want a disparity of cost between physical media and digital media, so if you launch a game both ways, you need to have the price be the same, which creates higher costing digital games on the switch store vs any other platform. The cost of the cartridge also varies depending on size of the game, so larger games will suffer more to this than smaller ones.That's my loaded opinion which turned more into a typed rant on the switch. Its still a pretty ok console that provides a ton of unique experiences that you can't get on any other platform. As a sole console I don't think I would recommend this unless you fully know what you are getting into, but as a side device to play exclusives its not bad. Hopefully they will release new hardware and software updates to fix many of the gripes I rambled on about.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2019
reviews.name: Lottie C.
reviews.title: For the child inside all of us
reviews.review: I love my Switch, this console really brings me back to my childhood, there is something about it that recaptured that magic I felt playing my Super Nintendo and even the GameCube. I've played every Nintendo console and while I was a major fan of the early ones, after the Cube, I got sucked into the Xbox 360 and then the PS4, but, this console is the first I've played in years that brings me back to that childhood magic. I got this console on a whim after watching Detective Pikachu and realizing how much I missed Pokémon games, so I had to get Let's Go Pikachu and pre-order Pokémon Shield, as well as getting back into Mario, and checking out Fire Emblem Warriors which is totally amazing. All in all, not only are the exclusive games amazing, but, the console and even the joycon controller rig are something special. I can't put my finger on it, and I really can't put it into words, but this is a great system and for kids or those trying to rediscover the child inside of them, this is a must have. Just don't try to get inside a child with this is, or you're going to jail sicko.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2020
reviews.name: M
reviews.title: Buy it for the exclusives or don't buy it at all.
reviews.review: If you look at Nintendo's list of exclusive games and think, "Yeah, I'm all about that", dive in. This is a fun console that offers play on your TV screen or handheld (switch... duh). With multiple controller configuration options including extra peripherals that will make your controller become a steering wheel, a golf club, a fishing pole, and a fitness ring just to name a few, there is a lot of fun and creativity built into Nintendo's latest console.Add to all of this, with a Nintendo Online subscription you get access to tons of free and low cost games. They have included a virtual NES and SNES console with a good selection of classic games. There are also other free games like Tetris 99 and the new Super Mario 35 which are loads of fun. There are also lots of other games that can be had for as little as $2.99If however you're looking for a console to play the latest cross platform hits, you're probably better off with a PC or one of the next gen gaming consoles. Playing a big cross platform game, you will notice a difference in graphics quality. The Switch only displays in HD, while every other console (and pc) is up to 4K now. Plus the Nintendo controllers, while fun and creative, will not hold up to long term play for something like a FPS. They are fun controllers, and work perfectly for the Nintendo games, but they feel like they would ultimately break after a few serious button mashing sessions. If you've seen all the drama about controller drift, you now know why.Bottom line is if you're all about Nintendo exclusives like Mario, Zelda, Animal Crossing, Metroid? (please?), get this console. It will provide a great deal of entertainment. If you're trying to play the big gaming hits available across all consoles and PC, there are better options.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2019
reviews.name: The Gamer
reviews.title: Great
reviews.review: I was suppose to receive my package October 27th. I didn't receive my package until the 29th. It wasn't Amazon fought at all. I blame USPS for screwing up. They sent my package to the wrong address. So I had to go online and have them redeliver my package.When I finally receive my package I notice it wasn't damaged or tampered with. The switch box was still intact thank God. One thing I notice is the switch itself looks more premium if that makes any type of sense. Lol You can tell they fixed a lot issues with the joycons and other things. My OG switch had so many flaws. My TV screen would go black then turn back on for some reason while playing. The vents on my switch ended up melting off. The back had so many scratches from the dock.Anywho, the battery life is amazing!! If you're like me and you play your switch an hour a day. It will last for a couple days. If you're the type that play your switch for hrs. You can get up to 9hrs of play depending on the game you're playing.Im glad I got the upgraded version. 5/5

reviews.title: The best gaming console!!
reviews.review: I cannot rave about the Switch enough!!! It truly is one of the best gaming consoles. I never was really a big “gamer” but always enjoyed Nintendo games such as Mario Kart and other related games. This console is great for both kids and adults, it is also great for solo or multiplayer games. I absolutely love the convenience of being able to play either on the big screen or handheld mode. The battery life on the handheld is pretty good for it being a larger sized console but if you’re playing for multiple hours I will need to be charged. All in all this truly was one of the best purchases I’ve made for entertainment. I highly recommend this console to everyone of all ages!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2021
reviews.name: Owen L.
reviews.title: Worth the money wait and hunt.
reviews.review: Ok. The Switch is a masterpiece when it comes to the library. I’ve spent more time than I would like to admit playing Breath of the Wild. Smash Ultimate is the best in the series, along with Mario maker 2.The resolution is a problem for some other hardcore gamers, but HD is fine for me. I really don’t care if it’s not “4K, 60fps”.The controls are super advanced. Li always play with the grip, even if Motion controls are recommended. I don’t personally own a Pro controller for the switch, but I’ll consider it. I have a Wii U Pro-controller which is my favorite controller for the system.The Switch approves upon the Wii U in most ways. The Wii U does however possess a better UI, more comfortable controls, and Virtual console.Overall the Nintendo Switch is worth the hunt and the money. The console has the best library since the N64.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2021
reviews.name: Jay
reviews.title: The Switch is riddled with controller disconnects and pairing issues
reviews.review: After owning the original Wii for years and enjoying it with 0 problems I decided on getting the Switch, even though I mainly play my games on PC now a days, I thought it would be a great console for my wife and I to come together every now and then to play. I was lucky to score one when Nintendo finally got it back in stock after months of no stock because of the pandemic. The first day I got it the right (red) joy con kept disconnecting every 5-10 minutes. I was literally 5 feet away from the console with line of sight. After going through the troubleshooting steps of disconnecting joy cons and updating the console OS and controller firmware, it still had the same problem. The left (blue) joy con worked flawlessly. I searched online and found hundreds if not thousands of posts about people experiencing disconnecting joy cons and various work-arounds. Some even claimed that by having your foot propped up in front of the line of sight would cause all sorts of controller issues including lag and disconnects. So I did my long hours of testing, purchasing new official joy cons, and 3rd parties and am discouraged by my findings.Ultimately I found that the built-in bluetooth radio in the switch is just not powerful enough. Considering the amount of posts regarding controller pairing and disconnects issues, I would say the problem has been known for a long time. And instead of Nintendo recalling or replacing their poorly designed consoles they blame the environment or user error. They state things like "make sure your console is away from wireless devices of any kind". Seriously? Everyone has 20 wireless devices in their house from cell phones, routers, modems, smart TV's, wireless speakers, smart hubs, Alexa devices, the list goes on. Nintendo even states to keep the Switch away from fish tanks. Really? Soon they'll be saying to keep the switch away from air and light.I contacted Nintendo within the first week I got the Switch after getting fed up with dying because of constant controller lag and disconnects. Tier 1 support is a joke. They just want you to send it in which customer pays for shipping, and I may get my console back in 30 days. So after back and forth discussion with Tier 1 support I finally found that there is an escalation line which they forwarded me to which seems to be a line of seniors or assistant managers. Again they wanted me to send in the console. I called BS and explained that the console was only a week old. We finally agreed that I would temporarily pay for a replacement right joy con, and only after they received my defective right joy con that I would get reimbursed. New right joy con came, had the same problems albeit it was less noticeable, less disconnects. I sent my old one to them and it took them 30 days to refund my money which was $50 because they had to inspect the controller for any damage or mods. Seriously? I eventually got my money back but what a pain.Fast forward about a month and lag and disconnects are still happening. I purchased a brand new official joy con from Amazon and even though it hasn't outright disconnected it has shown lag issues again, sitting 5 feet away from the console and with direct line of sight. I even started unplugging wireless devices like my wireless speaker, just to see if anything would increase the controllers range and reliability and nothing helped.At the end of the day the Nintendo Switch is riddled with controller issues and I am not even getting into the whole "drifting" problem that people are suing Nintendo over. Now a days it seems that companies just release untested unreliable electronics, even the all and might Nintendo company, and don't take responsibility for it. A player needs reliable controllers to play a consoles content AKA joy con controllers for the Nintendo Switch, like a player needs a reliable mouse and keyboard for playing PC games. And for the price tag of an official Nintendo Switch joy con set at around $70 I expect them to be flawless, and their from from it. And this console isn't even new. It's been out for several years and Nintendo has had plenty of time to fix their issues, and they have chosen to blame us, the consumers instead of taking ownership of the problem.I plan to exchange the Switch for another using the Amazon exchange policy. Luckily, my purchase qualified for the holiday return policy so I have until February 1st to return it. If the new one acts up the same way I will be returning it and will be calling my credit card company to reimburse the 4 games I purchased from the Switch store since the Nintendo store has a no refund policy, which is a complete joke and such a policy should be discouraged.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2020
reviews.name: melanie
reviews.title: PAGUE POR UN PRODUCTO NUEVO Y RECIBI UN OPENBOX
reviews.review: La caja de amazon estaba entre abierta, no estaba totalmente cerrada. El producto venia en una caja sin ningun sellos de seguridad (es un open box) . Yo pague por un producto nuevo. La caja no estaba en optimas condiciones. Tampoco tenia ningun tipo de proteccion.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2020
reviews.name: Amy Dix
reviews.title: Very pleased!
reviews.review: We got lucky and only paid $299.99 for this Switch. If I were you, I would hold out until you can find one for MSRP. Don't pay these ridiculous inflated prices.It came new in the box, never used, and came with everything needed. Power adapter, dock, HDMI cable, joy-con grips, and the wrist straps. Switch had half a charge upon arrival, and set up just fine.Joy-cons work great.Reads and plays a cartridge game. I'm excited to play this more! It has very nice feeling controls, incredible graphics (compared to the Wii that I was used to), and the console is very small and compact.Don't hesitate to pick this up. But before you do, DON'T pay $400 or over for it. That's ridiculous.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2019
reviews.name: T. Werkema
reviews.title: Game system is great but joy cons are a disappointment
reviews.review: The game system we received is the newer one with better battery life. However, we've been disappointed with the joys cons. Both right joy cons in the included one and another set we bought would disconnect. If you read online there are all kinds of issues with the joy cons ever since they made the system. There are fewer problems since they updated them, however, the joy cons we received with this system are dated 2017, before they updated them. So, new game system, old joy cons. Seriously disappointed in this. Nintendo is in the process of setting up a warranty repair, but I shouldn't have to do this for a brand new system. The individual set we bought is going back and we purchased new ones in a local store that should theoretically be newer. To initiate the repair Nintendo asked about a hundred questions and 2 hours later the repair is accepted. Not a good setup, in my opinion.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2021
reviews.name: Mikel Ilasco
reviews.title: If you love being around people, get the Switch!
reviews.review: I absolutely loved the concept of the Nintendo Switch and decided to get one due to its popular demand. It’s pretty awesome and best to get it at the normal price of $299.99 because it really isn’t worth $300.00+ and it really refreshes the gaming atmosphere. However, handheld mode is so enormous that it’s a little uncomfortable. I was on the fence about buying this or the Nintendo Switch Lite, because I rarely have anyone else around to play some really cool multiplayer games like Mario Kart 8 Deluxe or Super Smash Bros. Plus, the Switch Lite doesn’t come with controller/joy con problems and is smaller, more comfortable, and accessible. One other thing that stands out on the Lite is it has a smaller screen but games look a bit sharper on it. That said, some of the free games are pretty addictive! I think it was totally worth the $300.00, but it does cost $20 to buy Nintendo Online to play any Nintendo game’s online player. I also wouldn’t recommend buying a Pro controller because the joy con controller is pretty comfortable, so far. If you’re someone who loves hanging around friends and family, get the regular Switch. If you’re a solo and lone wolf type of badass, get the Switch Lite!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2021
reviews.name: Nessy
reviews.title: Might Not Be Brand New As Advertised
reviews.review: I received my switch a lot sooner than expected, and I bought a new one but I'm not so sure that it's actually brand new. I had watched a couple of unboxing videos beforehand and it was supposed to come with the standard 32GB memory card, but it didn't; the slot was empty and the flap on the box to open it looks like it has been opened before, which leads me to believe that Amazon might not actually be selling brand new switches. Aside from that, everything looks really good with no scratches and works great so far. I'll give an update if anything changes.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2020
reviews.name: Chester
reviews.title: Great overall system for gaming with friends!
reviews.review: Similar to other Nintendo systems, innovation is always attached to their new ideas. The joy cons are similar to the wii remotes, albeit not as precise for some games where they were used for shooting type games, the joy cons are incredible for multiplayer. I honestly prefer using one joycon whenever I can when playing games, it's really nifty being able to play two player automatically with a friend or family member without having to pay for an expensive controller, or a cheaper built one.Nintendo Apps are so-so at the moment, it would be great to have streaming apps such as Netflix for streaming, but other apps such as Youtube have worked well streaming but I do not like the interface for searching for videos.When playing online, after paying for a year subscription, was not as bad as the days of the Nintendo Wii, but it could be better. Wifi play has always been a struggle for companies and consumers that I don't expect to go away with any patch made by Nintendo. Buying the year subscription also includes many nes/snes games you can play with the joy cons in single/multiplayer. My roommate got rehooked playing super mario world and it was a blast seeing someone who says they "hate games with bad graphics".Overall, if you're looking for a system for on the go or for a house hold device, the Nintendo Switch is a excellent system with a good range of games to play on. My young nephew and kid siblings are a fan of it; and same for me and several of my friends who are in our early 20s.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2021
reviews.name: SwampdonkeY
reviews.title: Family Fun System With Issues
reviews.review: The switch is a fun system when it works. 3 months in this piece of delicate plastic stopped "switching." The console works when plugged into the dock and displays on the TV but not when removed from the dock. When removed from the dock the screen is black but sound can be heard. A hard reset reveals the Nintendo logo for a split second then the switch image for a split second, by accident. Then blackness. Placing the console back on the dock allows you to play on the TV but what is the point if the handheld device does not work. Contacted Nintendo support and after some time-wasting, I'll need to send it in for a warranty repair. Should be without the device for over a month by current estimates.Another issue: Setting up the 37 accounts, email logins, user names, and other associated nicknames and logins is a ridiculous process.Overall, this would be a one-star review if it wasn't so much fun to play as a family or with others online.Other reviews are accurate. These controllers, accessories, and other garbage required to play are delicate and expensive.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2020
reviews.name: C. Taker
reviews.title: Refurbished units break after little use.
reviews.review: After a little over a month of (very light) use, the hdmi connection no longer works. The switch will still charge while in the dock, but I cannot play on the TV while in docked mode. I can confirm it is an issue with the refurbished switch as I have another switch that I use personally, that works with both docks, my original switch dock and the dock provided with the refurbished one.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2020
reviews.name: Brianne
reviews.title: Be patient it’s worth the wait.
reviews.review: I was so lucky!!! I happened to randomly check one morning after I had already given up on my search for a switch at retail price and THEY WERE IN STOCK FOR 299!! (sold by amazon) I nearly cried of happiness and immediately bought it. It took a week and a couple days to get here, there was a delay in my delivery. I was worried they had sold me a sold out switch but nope it came in! Just hold on and be patient and don’t buy from these greedy scalpers. A few things about the system itself:The stand is hard to pop out if you don’t have nails (especially if you bite your nails like me) so I bought a stand for it. The game cartridge part is a little hard to take out at first too and I thought I broke It but it’s flimsy plastic so it bends.The controllers are kinda small if you have larger hands.I would also recommend a screen protector, carrying case, and a stand (so you don’t have to keep opening the kickstand it comes with)

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2021
reviews.name: Afterhourshop
reviews.title: overpriced gameboy
reviews.review: Technology is supposed to get faster, stronger power, better visuals, easier to use, smaller, AND CHEAPER!Nope! Just like NAZA claims we can no longer go to moon because they cant rebuild that technology, this overpriced game is a nod to that greed and lies. This toy is actually really cool, and maybe worth $150-200, but its overpriced games and controller itself makes for more to be desired.What is really sad is that kids today are getting so much 2D flat screen time , their eyes, and brains are deteriorating, and not getting enough outdoor 3D activity. When you have 3D on a 2D device, you are dummying down your brain and vision on how it sees reality.Medical tests have already been done and this is evident.So parents are the ones who need to limit such screen activity, as the body and brain develops.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2021
reviews.name: Melissa
reviews.title: Very very impressed..UPDATED
reviews.review: Ya no I'm not one to buy used products,but this is second time I decided to buy used..I do pick the used very good thou..But still been used either way..So today got it and I'm astonished how well amazon packs there used products and how new everything looks.I was not sorry first time i bought used so I'm hoping will not be this time..Looks in too top brand new shape,but have to wait till 17th to hook it up and test it as it is daughters bday gift.So i will at that time do a review and pics to show how fabulous it is..So if u was like me afraid to buy anything used or refurbished I'm just saying give it a shot,I'm sure 9x out of 10 u wont be sorry..REVIEW TO COME AFTER 17TH.UPDATE:3/8/21 Everything is great except the controllers. They absolutely are horible.Will not stay charged for no more than 20 mins tops.Atleast the ones that came with the console I got..But everything else is perfectSo if u buy this console,I would get extra set of controllers right away..

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2021
reviews.name: Hasasuki
reviews.title: Nintendo Switch
reviews.review: It's really nice to take your console game anywhere you want! It sucks that Nintendo didn't give us enough storage space, so make sure you buy a microSD card to store your games and their content. I read that it's better to buy the physical game discs. They take up less space, but if you want to download all of your games go for it. If you play a medium amount of games I would recommend the 256GB - 512GB microSD cards. There is a 1TB microSD card on amazon for around $300.00. Get this one if you're a hardcore Nintendo player. There are many accessories on amazon to also decorate your Switch. You can decorate the controllers with skins or buy the different color joy-cons. The exclusive Pickachu one has nice Pichachu designs on the stand, and I think there's also an Eevee version both from Japan that cost $500 or more. You can also buy the Switch Lite which seems much more available now with the pandemic raging. Explore and find the version of Switch that works for you.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2021
reviews.name: Melissa
reviews.title: Drift issues. Controller lasted 8 days.
reviews.review: This item was a hot item during the pandemic which made it almost impossible to buy. When it was available they were being sold at unbelievable prices. So imagine my luck after months searching for a switch to buy they suddenly became available again in September. I bought it quickly with the intent to hold onto it as a Christmas gift for my children. Bad mistake. Now 2 weeks after Christmas the controller that was included with the switch is not working. It has drift issues so it won't let my children go to the left and keeps moving to the right without them doing anything. I figured okay, it must be defective so I will call Amazon and hopefully they can fix this for me or just send me a new controller. Apparently NOT. Amazon says the item is out of the return window and there is nothing they can do. Now here I am stuck with a controller that lasted 8 days total and apparently prices are between 79 and 108 just for a replacement controller. Complete waste of money.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2020
reviews.name: Jill C.
reviews.title: Bit of a rocky start but good for now!Wish it was as sturdy as my old PS2,now that is a beast...
reviews.review: I bought this system for myself as a birthday present, and I have enjoyed using it!The controllers took a bit getting used to detaching on and off properly.I think the main thing is to be careful about what games you buy if the device will be worth it to you in the end, or if you are excited about upcoming games.I waited to purchase the Switch until I knew there were about ten games I wanted to play and added about three of them into the in initial cost as well.I’m pretty picky about my games because I am a casual gamer. Zelda breath of the wild—which I borrowed from my brother later— is more intensive than anything I have played in YEARS.Games are expensive in physical format, although that is my preference.There are some cheaper games on the online store.So far my favorite local game shop does not have any used copies of Switch games although they have everything else.Maybe some day.I might buy a screen protector for it in the future but have not as of yet.If your Switch is to see heavy use by an entire family or if as an owner you plan to travel with it I’d recommend one but that is not the case for me. I did have a problem within a month of ordering the machine where the fan started whirring LOUDLY.At first only when it was plugged in to charge then all the time when it was at rest, then at last even while playing a game.I called Nintendo customer service and had it repaired (although I had to send it back three times with the same issue to a radioshack in Syracuse NY.Last time I sent it in they just replaced the system.)If I have a problem in the future I will request replacement rather than repair, especially if it’s going back to New York.Just not happening.At least customer service was good, but I was becoming a bit disgruntled toward the end there with their techs!For my troubles customer service gave me a new set of controllers automatically and then later, three months free on the eshop.Oh, and the second and third shipments were two day free.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2020
reviews.name: Andrew n.
reviews.title: Good for Gaming on the Go, but not the ideal console for all gamers
reviews.review: It's a good console. It's not amazing. There is a limited selection of AAA games, more so if you like action and FPS genres. You have more than enough RPGs to choose from and a lot of the Asian anime style games (not sure what they're called). Nintendo's own selection is PG as always. It sounds odd to say this, but my mistake was buying this when I'm not a Nintendo fan. The lack of support from major developers and studios means that I eventually turned to a laptop to meet my real gaming needs.PROS:Gaming on the move: great on airiplanes and to bring on tripsEasy couch coop for supported gamesHolds charge for a good amount of timeMain console body is durable AF. I dropped mine down a flight of stairs and it had no dentsCONS:Joycons are a straight rip-off. They will fail on you then you'll have to pay 40-60 USD for replacementsLimited game selection (this is the biggest issue). Almost none of the large developers are supporting the Switch. Some of them are trying, but the Switch hardware is already behind the times with current-gen releases and you get knocked-down graphics. EA gives you remasters or roster updates, Take Two remasters decade old releases, etc. and all of these are released at crazy prices. You pay US$ 40 for games being sold for $5 on PCs and consoles, it's ridiculous.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2020
reviews.name: Em
reviews.title: GREAT!! I LOVE IT. DO NOT BUY FROM SCALPERS.
reviews.review: I finally caved and got one (of course at retail price. It’s great so far, I love it. The box came on time and in good condition. Very easy set-up!I’ve never had a console before, so this is my first official one!! I was considering between this and the lite, but I think it’s totally worth it getting this one. I like to have the option to play it on my TV. I also didn’t think the switch screen would be that big but it’s actually a decent size.The controllers are so bright, especially the red. I wasn’t expecting neon pink. I’ve seen videos and pictures of the switch, but it’s nothing compared to seeing it in-person.I was iffy about buying it on Amazon, even if it was from Amazon themselves instead of resellers, but this turned out great.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2021
reviews.name: gakv
reviews.title: Incomple!
reviews.review: The media could not be loaded. The box had everything inside except the console and controls, annoying experience!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2019
reviews.name: Greg
reviews.title: I received the correct version
reviews.review: I received the newer model, as advertised and it has been great.No complaints on the system - it's exactly what I was looking for.Make sure to pay attention to which models go on sale this Black Friday.The newer one (red box) has a new graphics chip which allows better battery life and a slightly different screen.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2020
reviews.name: E.B.
reviews.title: Very entertaining but overpriced. All in all satisfied with the purchase
reviews.review: I have only tried the game in hand held and tablet mode, I am also using a samsung galaxy charger because it is less bulky. So I cant comment on the dock and charger, though I wish they are working fine 😅The game console is the v2 with the longer battery lifetime, it is amazing and very entertaining. I have played zelda and mario party and the graphics are amazing and very enjoyableI was lucky to get right before the prices went up and still I was thinking that 299.99 is overpriced given that there was no game with the console, so u had to buy a game usually ranging between 50-60$

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2021
reviews.name: Kimudo
reviews.title: Decent console with a nice option for the tv/projector
reviews.review: Hey, it's a Nintendo for 2021. It's fast, simple, and the games are clean. No long loading times and the controls are fairly intuitive. Battery life on the joy-cons is great, though the handheld version is a little lackluster... that's fixed by treating it like a standard console though... so yay.Only real sticking point is the price. For 300 bucks, it feels a bit steep. Many of the games feel like time-eaters for casual players, and there's no browsing or media to speak of. Again though, this is Nintendo and as a game console, it plays games. They play smoothly and have a very finished feel to them. Sign of the times and all that.Overall, a very nice machine if you just want to sit down and play without all the bells and whistles.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2021
reviews.name: Someone
reviews.title: Got a 2nd one because the first one was popular
reviews.review: Sniped my first one off amazon and within a week, my friend bought it from me for the same price. I kept searching and found a gray one from amazon that was in acceptable condition. It had no box and came just randomly shoved in a box but nothing had a scratch on it. Amazon has good prices and good products. There is a reason I keep buying this system. Its a must have!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2019
reviews.name: Richard D. Cameron III
reviews.title: What an improvement!
reviews.review: The new battery life is amazing. I bought this for my significant other for our anniversary to play the new Pokemon games on with me. During some preliminary tests right before the games release, hers outlasts my original unit by hours. So this is a much improved unit and I am debating just buying me one and gifting my old unit to a family friend or something.Plus new joy-cons always feel nice in your hands. And the colors are amazing.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2021
reviews.name: Liz
reviews.title: Careful buying new from a refurbishing company
reviews.review: I was quite disappointed with finding a very noticeable crack in the screen (1st picture). The description made it seem like the switch only had minor flaws (if any) like those displayed in the second picture I shared. It took a bit of maneuvering to get a shot with the minor scratches in it. These aren’t so noticeable and I don’t mind them but the crack is an eye sore and I can only hope my son isn’t upset when he opens it for his birthday next weekend...Initially, the seller didn’t provide the accessories (plug and such) and I didn’t notice this error til after they emailed me. They were very quick to realize their mistake and corrected it right away. I actually got the email the same day the accessories arrived so it was absolutely fine in my book. I just wish I hadn’t paid full retail price for an item with such a major flaw in it. It seems to power up and work just fine though.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2020
reviews.name: Christopher Robbins
reviews.title: Great Product from a Trustworthy Seller!!
reviews.review: I bought this Nintendo Switch from this Seller. It was an Extra $145.00 than the original Retail Price of $300.00, but I believe that was because of the Switch Shortage that happened everywhere due to COVID-19. The actual Product I received was top notch though. It was packaged very well. I didn't have a problem opening it which I have had with some other Products which actually lead to me accidentally damaging those items. But no such problem here. The actual Switch itself was also in perfect condition. No scratches anywhere on any of it. And nothing was missing. It runs perfectly fine too. Nothing wrong with it whatsoever. I am very happy with it. The only downside, like I said, was the Price, but is understandable given the Pandemic and Shortage. So I'm giving this Five Stars. Great job!!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2020
reviews.name: thezookeeper
reviews.title: Poor Customer serviceand have to wait over 14 days for a refund.Buyer beware.
reviews.review: So I contact them to tell them it's defective and they reply."if nintendo will repair it that may be the best option, but it is up to you"Buyers beware

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2019
reviews.name: James A.
reviews.title: By far the best console nintendo has made since the gameboy advance
reviews.review: The Wii and Wii u were cool consoles, but i really only used them to play like mario, or gamecube games on, they were never really used to play "wii games". well the switch completely turns my opinion of nintendo consoles around. I have a gameboy advance, and still play the old pokemon games on it from time to time, but the switch is so much more than that. Its like combining all of the good things about a wii, a gameboy advance, and even an old n64, and packing it all into one box, that can even be taken on the go.I am super excited to own one, and i cant wait for more switch games to come out, BOTW, lets go eevee, Smash, the upcoming pokemon sword, and mario odyssey are my definite favorites.THOUGH THEY NEED TO FIX JOYCON DRIFT (sigh)

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2021
reviews.name: Unique
reviews.title: No console included
reviews.review: Be very careful ordering expensive items like this. There was no console or joy con (red or blue) in the box upon arrival. I thank God I opened the box and looked since I bought this in advance for my son's birthday. Someone really dropped the ball with this one. They deserve zero stars for that. The box was not sealed either letting me know that it was not new like I was led to believe.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2020
reviews.name: RICK L.
reviews.title: Nintendo switch,Good system, terrible quality control
reviews.review: The switch is a very nice system, read the reviews of wobbly joy con’s which there are many of but figured what are the chances I get one with that issue, Ordered it as a christmas gift, arrived on time the week before, christmas day, present gets opened and of course the joy con is wobbling, not enough to come loose but enough that it would definitely preoccupy while you play. Not for nothing but nintendo is getting to dollar, offering the worst deals on the switch and with the switch being it’s big hit , still can’t have quality control, the switch should feel as solid as a tank, not cheap when the joy con wiggles right out if the box and nintendos policy for fixing their mistake in my particular right out if the box defect is that they might send you a replacement which might be the plain grey/black instead if the colored joy con that I paid for is imo,a disgusting business practice, way to stand by their flagship product and instantlyturned me into a never by another nintendo product for anyone person. Listen, its a nice system but the quality is lacking and their support even for their mistake is insulting, so buyer beware, you’re playing quality roulette.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2022
reviews.name: You know that guy you know
reviews.title: did you know the dock doesn't have ethernet?
reviews.review: you should know that.did you know the microSD card expansion isn't used for anything?you should know that.it's just there to let you imagine all the awesome uses it must have that you just haven't discovered yet.did you know that owning 2 switches and 2 copies of mariokart isn't enough to race together over your LAN?you should know that.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2020
reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Can't complain much with Device. High quality. Seamlessness. Worth the Money 👌
reviews.review: Many things could be said about this device but, there's so many things that make up for it.Seamless connectivity with mostly everything. Joy-cons(controllers) connect right away once attached through wireless electrical conduction like a power mat.The U.I. makes me happy. ((Home screen(desktop) layout))The different ways have use the controllers are interesting indeed:Like, Smash Ultimate, if you have one joycons set you split the controllers into two controllers for you friend or friends (if you have a second controller set) to play locallyBreath Of The Wild, with the aiming mechanic by steadily rotating wrist(which is optional)The Ease of purchasing games is and points towards a discount is fair.Nintendo polish is not joke.👍Joycons do once in awhile lose sync with Device but reconnects in 2-10 seconds and can disrupt gameplay a tad but you get over it a few seconds because your totally immersed with yourself.So I give it a 100% green light on the a virtuous mission. Spread you wings and fly, God be with you.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2021
reviews.name: bryan
reviews.title: Quick delivery
reviews.review: We received it quickly, my son absolutely loves it. We've had no problems what so ever.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2021
reviews.name: D. White
reviews.title: Won't work on Hisense ROKU tv
reviews.review: I purchased this in July but didn't get to set it up until yesterday.Set it up on my Hisense ROKU tv and it worked for about an hour.Had a ball with my niece playing dance 2020.I won a round and figured I'd quit on a high note.She played with it not using the tv for about an hour and then it was bed time.Woke up today to try to use it and all I'm getting is a flash of the game console and then a "is it connected message?".Did a quick youtube search and came up with plugging/unplugging, get a new cable, get a new docking station and changing the settings on the Hisense.Didn't want to do that because.....wth???? I came here to see if I could return it and saw that I had past the return window.Then tried it on my older smaller bedroom tv and it worked fine.Seriously disappointed that it won't work on the newer, bigger main living room tv.Today is a holiday so I'll contact nintendo support tomorrow to see if there is a fix for this.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2022
reviews.name: brian clowser
reviews.title: Good price, good product
reviews.review: The price was good, it came with everything it said it would and it works like it should. I wasn’t expecting to get it for about a month or so but it ended up coming 2 weeks early which was a nice surprise. I see a lot of bad reviews and they’re all mostly because of the price which I think isn’t really fair, saying you got price gouged but you’re the one that paid for it.. it’s not like you thought it’d be 300 and they changed the price to 400 after the fact. If you don’t wanna pay more then wait. I wanted to get this but Amazon was out of stock so I waited a couple days or so n it was back in stock and regular price. Anyway, good price good product.. works just like it said it would. If you’re thinking about getting a switch I would recommend getting an sd card for it cause 32gb isn’t really much and you can get a pretty cheap sd card.. I got one for about 25 bucks with 128gb. 👍👍

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2021
reviews.name: Chris
reviews.title: The Nintendo Switch is great for family use
reviews.review: The switch is a awesome gaming console, I use it for the family, here is some of the games I play with the family and maybe some of you guys can incorporate to add family time to play these games with.- Mario Party- Mario Kart- Just Dance- Monopoly- Uno- Carnival- Family Fued- Jack in the BoxI recommend the switch because it's overall and handy console you can go anywhere with and play games. You can even take it on vacation and play it too. I believe this is worth the $300 you pay for it. Just letting you know by playing some of these games you may burn friendships with you family members since they will probably be salty you beat them in something!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2020
reviews.name: Bernie
reviews.title: switch online is worth it in and of itself
reviews.review: Playing switch games is great, i bought 5 games with my system for variety. Turns out the most amazing feature i was not aware of before i started playing. The online subscription they offer for a measly 20 bucks a year offers a library of nes and snes games you can play at will. You can save state in them as well up to 4 save files for each game. You can ALSO reverse time when playing (it is a cheap feature but VERY cool still) Died in mario, just hold in two buttons, reverse the game like a dvr on tv show and bam, try that part again right where you just were!! i do not know if it is true but i read they have two more slots for future classic systems in their coding in the system. We have Nintendo 8bit, Super Nintendo but we could see Nintendo 64 or game cube in the future as well.All 5 games i picked up for it run great as well, no complaints except it was 150 dollars more than list price. Alas these are the times we live in.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2020
reviews.name: Tim
reviews.title: Pokemon came out, so I had to get it.
reviews.review: I knew people who owned the Switch were seemingly all very happy with it, and I planned on getting one at some point. When Pokemon moved to the Switch, "some point" became "right now".Nintendo likes to make their consoles unique. The DS Lite had two screens, a touch screen, and a microphone that were all used to make the experience unique. The 3DS, The Wii, and Wii U also had their own interesting elements. At times, it just felt gimmicky. The Switch on the other hand, doesn't feel that way at all.It's the gaming equivalent of a laptop with a docking station. You can have the TV experience like any other console, which is also great for party games. Then you can take it with you. This is basically THE go to gaming device for plane rides. The joycons are also genius. It is just incredibly versatile.I'm pleased that it has USB C. The Dock is easy to connect to as it literally just drops in place. I do think it could use more apps. it pretty much only has Hulu and YouTube at the time of this review, if I'm remembering correctly. I am a bit of a geek so I have plenty of other devices to watch on, but if it wants to compete with some of the other devices, it would be nice to have the option of watching Netflix, for example.I remember when the Wii first came out, and you'd go play the sports games with whoever had one. The novelty wore off before long. The Switch however, is here to stay. Brilliant device

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2021
reviews.name: ForeverYOUNG
reviews.title: Nintendo Switch
reviews.review: I actually purchased this so that I could have the chance to possibly play games with grandsons via the internet... so far I haven't done that.. and I have only played the Animal pet game ... it is interesting - but honestly, it's been sitting for a couple of weeks in it's charger and I haven't played it as long.It is fun to play in your hand or on your tv... but I will say it doesn't "consume" me or grab my attention.I did set it all up on my own and I am NOT technically brilliant - 60 years old.If I can do it, you can too.I had thought that because of the virus I would need some thing new to be a distraction, but I'd rather ride my bike or take a walk!Ha.I think it is a fun distraction - but apparently not every day.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2021
reviews.name: Rashaud
reviews.title: I have made the Switch!
reviews.review: Yeah there’s a Buyer Beware in these purchases But I for one am Highly Satisfied! While I personally respect The Wii U’s efforts The Switch was seen as Better for too many reasons to count! Nintendo did themselves a solid here! And Games like Mario Kart 8 Deluxe, Super Smash Brothers Ultimate and so Forth can’t help but say I told you so to Why The Nintendo Switch is already an all time Popcorn Nonsense Awesome Game Experience! Make the Switch if you must You won’t regret it!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2021
reviews.name: Angela
reviews.title: I love this game system
reviews.review: I’ve had this system for close to a year now. It has not given me any issues. It was packed and delivered with care. I love the game options and how easy it is to move from hand held play to playing games on my TV. My sister’s kids enjoy playing games on it and I feel they have game options for all ages. The joy cons come on and off easily but stay in place when you want them to. I do recommend getting a protective screen cover because over time the dock the game system goes into starts to kinda make places on the screen over time. Over all a great investment and good buy

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2022
reviews.name: N
reviews.title: Corruptionissues
reviews.review: I kept getting corruption issues with this switch. I thought it might be the SD card I reformatted it turned it off and back on did this over 3 times and it still didn'twork. I ended up going to targetto buy a new one and that one is working fine and downloadinggames. I also never received the joy-cons. I will be sending this one back.Update I went it back it's been a month and they haven't refunded my money. They also never updated the tracking so it doesn't say it's even picked up. Terribleseller to deal with.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2020
reviews.name: Jay
reviews.title: Nintendo Does It Again!
reviews.review: Can you ever go wrong playing Nintendo games? I mean, other than virtual boy. Everything Nintendo touches, turns to gold. I bought this for COVID thinking I'll relive Nintendo days, little did I know, this has become the biggest time sink in my life. I've neglected work, neglected family, neglected my own personal hygiene because I'm addicted to this console. The fact this is portable means there isn't a time that you can't play this game. Bathroom break? Take it with you. Resting your eyes by laying in bed? Take it with you. I've probably looked at this screen more than I looked at my significant other. No regrets.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2021
reviews.name: Namraets ^_~
reviews.title: Get with the Times.
reviews.review: Grown-up with Nintendo systems since the '80s. It never ceases to amaze me how they continue to grow. From the inventive Wii remote motions to now play on the go. Just wow. Bought the physical copy of the Mario with 64/Sunshine/Galaxie- and have been happily playing every night before bed. My 5-year-old is loving the Mario 3D- It is so cool. We had a bit of a row with the controllers, though. They took some getting used to. Even the buttons that you have to push in order to unlock the small controls to the accessories took time to loosen up. Overall- I am glad I found the counsel at the $299.00 price point. Anything more, I probably wouldn't have bought.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2019
reviews.name: Marilyn M. Smith
reviews.title: Very Dirty Switch I demand a replacement
reviews.review: It came very dirty. Dark blobs of dirt on Joy cons and plenty of dirt and fingerprints all over the screen. This is absolutely unacceptable. I am returning it and I demand a replacement. Did I just buy a used Switch for full price???

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2020
reviews.name: JerryCool
reviews.title: Nintendo Switch Dock didn't work (AC Adapter issue or Dock issue?)
reviews.review: We place an order on 8/8 and receive it on 8/15 during the weekend. We purchase a Mario party and start to play today on 8/17. But we find out the Nintendo Switch Dock can't work, even the green-light of the Dock doesn't show up. (Nintendo Switch itself is working well.)We're not sure if it's a AC Adapter issue or Nintendo Switch Dock issue.Just send an email to Nintendo Switch website for request support and wish we can get the adapter & dock replacement. Otherwise, we should just buy the Nintendo Switch Lite for saving money.It's really a bad experience for my first time purchasing something from Amazon.com within past few years.Can customer support of Amazon.com help or we need to contact Nintendo Switch directly without any help from Amazon.com? Thank you!Jerry Huang

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2021
reviews.name: Kristen A.
reviews.title: No regrets. I waited and snapped it up when it was in stock again at retail price.
reviews.review: Finally got my hands on one at the retail price last month (To hell with price gougers.I don't ever support them. I hope they die of Covid) and I am having a lot of fun with it. I'm usually a pc gamer but I really like that this is portable too. The battery life is nice and the motion controls are alright but I tend not to use them.I was confused about where to put my micro sd card till I looked it up. It's hidden under the kickstand which is kind of flimsy and the only real con when compared to the list of pros. So far I've got Skyrim, Lego Harry Potter, My Time at Portia, Nine Parchments, and the Deponia games to occupy me for now. I've wanted one of these for a long time and I do not regret my purchase.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2022
reviews.name: DHT
reviews.title: Fun...It's Nintendo!!
reviews.review: Hummed and hawed and then I bought!!! We are huge Nintendo fans, we are not great gamers, each of us sucks hysterically in/at different games so a whole lot of fun is had by all.Will say the game cartridges and joy-con's are small but pfftt....who cares. Navigating the system / interface itself is a learning / teaching curve vs the Wii but the fam will catch on or keep watching me :)We bought (under $15) "steering wheels" & "golf clubs" to enhance game experience but even without them it's a bunch o' fun!!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2021
reviews.name: John Doe
reviews.title: Its ok for a secondary console.
reviews.review: Its neat that you can use it as a hand held or a console. I like how small and convenient it is. Its pretty easy to use. Downside is I can't really justify the purchase as someone who has another console. I literally only got this for Poke'mon. It doesn't seem to have very many other entertaining games for adults that you can't already play on a different console. I might give the new Zeldas a try. I do like I can bring it on a trip though.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2020
reviews.name: Steven L
reviews.title: Totally worth $299.
reviews.review: If you’re willing to wait, Amazon occasionally gets some, and puts them up at regular price.Received mine much sooner than their initial estimate. As for the console... it’s fun, everyone knows that. Great first-party games, and a nice selection of third-party games. Okay battery, unusual but feature-packed controllers, and a tiny bit uncomfortable for extended play in handheld mode. Less powerful than its competitors, but ray tracing does not a good game make.Just do everyone a favor and don’t pay a scalper for the console. That’s the only way to choke them out. Stay patient and check multiple stores, regularly. Eventually you’ll find one at the proper price. You’ll have your dignity, do a service for the community, and definitely get your money’s worth!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2020
reviews.name: Kevin Chu
reviews.title: Received a Chinese switch in a US box
reviews.review: Scam alert!Be very careful. I just received this from Amazon, not a reseller, and everything was fine until I booted up the system and it was all in Chinese.Apparently the Chinese version is language locked and can’t play most games.Seems like the Chinese console got placed into a US box.Returning now.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2019
reviews.name: Alexus Rose
reviews.title: Great console
reviews.review: I really wanted to be able to play video games while I was at work. I am a doctor and some nights just are slow since I work ER/Overnight. This was the easiest route for me to have the ability to game. Only issue I would say is the fact you need a capture card if you want to share with your friends via discord. Other than that, its easy to set up with TV/Just use with joycons. Accessories are expensive and so are games so I suggest figuring out exactly what you want and looking for sales etc. Also google how to make sure you are getting the new model since they are selling the old model with the same name. Theres a few things you can do to ensure you are getting the newest!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2020
reviews.name: Sarah Murray
reviews.title: Purchased 'used', feels like new.
reviews.review: I've been wanting a switch for a long time, and finally managed to get my hands on one close to MSRP (at $307) during the pandemic. I only have one game on it so far, but to say I'm pleased and impressed so far is a bit of an understatement. It's nice to be able to play on my TV in the living room, and when someone else wants to play their own game or watch Netflix, I can just take the switch out of the dock and play in handheld mode, but stay in the same room and socialize. I like being able to bring the game into my room and not be forced to play it in the living room if I don't want to deal with all the noise.It's pleasant to hold, with just a bit of weight to it to feel sturdy. The Joycons are nice to the touch, although the sticks are a little too 'smooth' for my liking so I put some grips on. I haven't experienced any drift, yet, but it's only been a few days. They're very satisfying to hold, and even more satisfying to click into place on either the tablet or the included joy-con grip. I haven't tried the straps yet.The screen is lovely, and the speakers are front-facing so it seems louder than other handhelds. It IS a little frustrating to adjust the volume while I have it on the kickstand. The kickstand is a pain to pull out, and isn't sturdy in the slightest.Overall I'm very, very happy with it. I can't wait to get more games on it and play with friends.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2021
reviews.name: hitokiri_ikaika
reviews.title: Nintendo Switch
reviews.review: Bought so I could play with the family when I have to travel for work. Bought in used-like new condition from Amazon. Inspected the product as soon as it arrived and found zero issues, didn't even appear to have been used at all. Everything was wrapped as if it was brand new. I also checked to ensure that someone with an older model Switch didn't Switch out their console withe the new one and then returned it. Needless to say, it was not the case and I did receive the new version. So far I have had zero issues, tons of games and hours of play time. Best part, it wasn't over priced in comparison to what is currently being offered by 3rd party sellers.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2020
reviews.name: Svartgotik
reviews.title: It's Nintendo's newest generation console - you know what this is.
reviews.review: I'm mainly going to list off the pros for this unit, something I like that they did on this generation compared to the other consoles by Nintendo and some gripes.Portability obviously with its docking capabilities - very good move.The way the Switch locates itself within the dock is a cool party trick.I like not having to have a rucksack full of gear just to bring my system with.The Joy-Con controllers are passable and you can actually play 2P games with each one.I do wish they offered a Pro-controller bundled version.The setup of the system is easy, you don't have to fill out another mortgage worth of EULAs to play.For pennies you get a slew of NES and SNES games through Nintendo Online.Mario Maker 2 is pretty fun and I wished more games had BYO levels like it(cue the wave of gamers that will correct me on 20+ games that have their own world-building options. I'm 43 and don't have time for games like I did in my teens.Let me dip my filthy casual toe back in the game pool now that my kids are grown.)

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2021
reviews.name: Paul Watson
reviews.title: A satisfying multi-use gaming device for the family
reviews.review: The Nintendo Switch is a nearly perfect gaming device for family use. With our one-TV household our Xbox Series S spends more time streaming Netflix than gaming while the Nintendo Switch can entertain both on the big screen and away from it.Out of the box it took a bit of time to get gaming as you need a Nintendo account. Pokemon Quest was the simplest and quickest to get going with. We haven't yet tried any "physical" games meaning we've only tried games you download (which the Xbox Series S/X excels at.)The multi-modality of the Nintendo Switch is great but be prepared to be disciplined with the various bits or you'll lose them. You'll also want to buy a screen protector and a carrying case. The build quality is pretty good but there is some flex when using it in mobile mode. The default brightness is underwhelming while the max brightness of the screen is only good enough if you are used to top-end mobile phones. The controller buttons are not backlit and have small print so for older parents like me you'll have to memorise what is X, A, B, Y etc.Nintendo Online is somewhat confusing and not quite what you get from Xbox Game Pass. Setting up kids profiles from the parent's Nintendo account is more complicated than it should be and creates blockers if you are away from WiFi. Nintendo, just let people play offline or online and sync it later.The games on offer are family friendly without being childish. You can relive Super Nintendo games with the Nintendo Online subscription. There are more games to create and explore than games to destroy and kill. The free-to-play games include some usual suspects but the list is quite short. There is no Roblox on the Nintendo Switch, yet, and you'll have to buy Minecraft, again.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2020
reviews.name: Daniel
reviews.title: Exceptional Portable Gaming Experience
reviews.review: This was my first hand held gaming device and I think it is a very unique, innovating what a portable console should be. I love the portability of it on the go and the ability to allow multiple players play at once. For $300 I think this is a solid gaming console that can be used to pour hundreds of hours into and still find games refreshing. The Nintendo game lineup also has the best exclusives out of the other competitors, from Mario to Zelda to Animal Crossing, there’s a game that suits anyone’s taste. Of course there are improvements to be made such as the joycons being small and sometimes uncomfortable in the even if you put it in together like a controller, it still doesn’t replace the feeling of a real full sized controller. In the future, I would just like Nintendo to make the portable screen 1080p with a 120hz refresh rate for an even better gaming experience. But overall, with its creativity and innovation still standing strong 3 years later, there isn’t much you can’t love about the Nintendo Switch.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2020
reviews.name: NewtypeShawty
reviews.title: DON’T GIVE IN TO PRICE GOUGES
reviews.review: Use apps like HotStock and Twitter bots like @_kinnybot to notify you instantly of switch restocks at retail $299. It may take a few days so be patient! It took me about a week or two at most. I missed a Walmart and a Best Buy one but I got lucky on Amazon thanks to kinnybot. So it is possible to get it without price gouges.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2022
reviews.name: Katie lenz
reviews.title: Do now buy switch from amazon!!! Received damaged!
reviews.review: I bought it a week ago as a gift for my family, when I got the package, it was all beats up and wonky. And the switch box itself doesn’t look great either. And when I open the box to see the system, it definitely looks used, the screen has a scratch on it. This is ridiculous, why would you do this me!??? I returned it the same day, now I have a very awkward family party with no switch to play and $300 out of my pocket since I can’t but another one from local store until I get my refund!!!!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2020
reviews.name: Matt Wheeler
reviews.title: Good
reviews.review: My son bought this for himself and he love the system. The battery life isn’t great but he mainly uses it at the house. He just goes back and forth from the handheld device to on the t.v. To charge it. I like it too since I can boot him off the only t.v. and he doesn’t complain since he can keep on playing it.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2020
reviews.name: Biggie
reviews.title: Overpriced
reviews.review: Beware that this a USED OVERPRICE Switch, NOT NEW.Double the MSRP of $299 new.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2020
reviews.name: Wilis M.
reviews.title: Nintendo hit a home run with the Switch.
reviews.review: The Switch is the console to have. We were very lucky to get one during the worst of the pandemic when they were sold out everywhere. Amazon really came through! Our 8-year old has loved playing Animal Crossing while stuck at home - 12 weeks so far! It's going to be a quiet stay-at-home summer, so I'm glad we have this as a distraction.We also have a Wii U which in many ways is the first generation of the Switch. A lot of ideas that Nintendo tried out on the Wii U went on to be implemented even better on the Switch - such as the handheld game pad. And the games! Mario Kart 8? First on Wii U. Breath of the Wild - Zelda? Also on Wii U. We love our Wii U and love the Switch even more!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2020
reviews.name: Susie Q
reviews.title: So glad I found this Switch on Amazon!
reviews.review: I had been looking for the Switch for my son sunce earlier this year. Due to Covid it was either constantly sold out or the prices were jacked up. I knew the MSRP and refused to be ripped off. I constantly looked at BestBuy, GameStop, Walmart, Target and others with no success. Both Amazon and EBay were too high priced. I told my son it was doubtful he would get one in time for Christmas and he had accepted that. Then a miracle happened and I found this Amazon seller who sold it for MSRP, plus shipped it quickly so we got it in time for Christmas! Highly recommend! Thank you. It works great too!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2022
reviews.name: Joette
reviews.title: Nothing but problems
reviews.review: Bought this for our son. Within days of receiving, the switch would disconnect from TV. Used at several different friends homes. Same problem. Troubleshooted with Nintendo. No improvement. Mailed product into Nintendo for repair/replacement. Switch continues to disconnect when connected to TV. Would not recommend anyone to buy Nintendo Switch. It has brought a lot of frustration and time involved trying to fix and still does not work. Too late to return to Amazon. Stuck with product that Amazon can’t take back and Nintendo can’t fix. Pretty much a waste of money and son is upset.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2020
reviews.name: David Delaney
reviews.title: Appears to be brand new
reviews.review: Item was in perfect condition when arrived.Shipped faster then expected.Four stars do to no manual, rather easy set up even without documents.I feel I was one of the last buyers at below three hundred dollars.This is the updated unit with extended battery life.No visuable damage at all.Unit runs perfectly, shipping box arrived undamaged, everything package neatly.Unit appeared to be brand new.Just decided to give this five stars, I honestly have no issues with item or seller.Would buy again from seller.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2021
reviews.name: Id_say_if_its_terrible
reviews.title: Husband loves it, I am less of a gamer so I am warming
reviews.review: Funny enough my husband claims he bought this for "us".That reminds me of the bowling ball my dad bought my mother in the 80s...let's be honest it was for him - not her.And that goes for a Switch, this is for him, not "us". Nonetheless, he really likes it and I like it because it is something he can play next to me without forcing me to endure hours of vdo games playing in the background. So win win.It is packable, fun to play, and easy to use.Kind of the perfect system for old and young folk.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2021
reviews.name: Elijah Maciejewski
reviews.title: Worth it if you want it
reviews.review: The ability to swap from dock to handheld still amazes me to this day. The library of games is crazy good, The battery life isn't bad, and the build is fairly durable. The screen is prone to scratching due to it being plastic, but a $10 screen protector fixes that easily. The controllers do go bad over time. I would recommend also purchasing a pro controller due to it having a better feel for me personally and they last far longer than any Joycon I've had. This purchase date was for my sister but I've had mine since near release and have gone through 3 pairs of Joycon, meanwhile my oldest pro controller (between 4 or 5 years) of the 3 I currently have has only shown slight signs of degradation. There is a "Nintendo tax" on some games which basically means they cost more than they would on other consoles (e.g. Borderlands collection I got on pc for like $20 where as the switch is charging $50 for games released between 2009-2014 so that you can play them on graphically worse hardware, but the portable part may be worth it for some people with certain games). The online services are really bad a lot of the time especially when playing with people who are far away or have otherwise unstable connections. Playing with random people online can be a very painstaking process a lot of the time. With all this being said, I love this console. It is the only console I use (I also have a pc and a ps4). I only look at it so critically due to how much I love it. If I didn't spend hours and hours using this thing I wouldn't be telling you all it's flaws in a 4-star review. It can be frustrating sometimes, but the exclusives are amazing (there are also a lot of great 3rd party games but I mainly mean that BOTW is a masterpiece and Mario Odyssey is phenomenal) and the "home console and handheld" idea is honestly incredible. I basically wrote an essay about this thing to tell you how much I love it.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2019
reviews.name: JorgeSosa
reviews.title: Muy mal servicio
reviews.review: compre la switch por Amazon.com Services LLC y al momento de conectar al televisor no funciona y al reclamar la garantia me indican que no pueden hacer nada. Tenia fe de que al comprar por aca tendria mejor soporte y aseguraba una compra de calidad pero no, viendo que ahora me toca quedarme con un nintendo defectuoso hubiera preferido pagar casi el doble en alguna tienda de electrodomesticos donde si aplicaria la garantia sin ningun problema. Lastima que siendo una pagina tan buena para compras no ayuden con la garantia ni te den soluciones al equipo defectuoso.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2022
reviews.name: Pmagz
reviews.title: Plz put warranty info with purchase info Amazon.
reviews.review: Purchased Asurion warranty for this and every electronic device I buy. Amazon plz store this purchase history together. I’d really like to use my warranty.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2020
reviews.name: E. Morgan
reviews.title: Not worth $300
reviews.review: My son loves the switch. However, the controllers are constantly not working and we have to buy new ones which are insanely expensive. At this point, I’ve paid almost as much as the switch itself in new controllers in just one year.I am going to try the Switch light and see if that works better. So, one year of this switch cost me almost $600 due to defective controller connection and parts. Highway robbery!!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2019
reviews.name: MoneyInTheWalls
reviews.title: Nintendo did it Again!
reviews.review: Fantastic Console! Nintendo truly knows how to design a solid gaming console from the portability of the Switch and being able to play it on the TV. What I love about the Switch is the games are actually full length instead of the shorter and more casual games on the 3DS.The games are expensive but the PS4 and Xbox were too when they first came out. The Switch is still a fairly new console and a lot of great ports are coming to it.I always look out for deals and end up with games for $40. Overall I truly am enjoying the Switch being an owner of a PS4 Pro and Xbox One S.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2021
reviews.name: Ramothrose
reviews.title: Fan started going out after a week of play
reviews.review: Bought brand new, not even a week passed and the fan is already making a noise. I have to send it in for repairs and since covid the repairs take 2-3 weeks. The only good thing is I do not have to pay for the repair…. But I am without my switch for 2-3 weeks. I just hope when I get it back they didn’t break something else trying to repair the fan.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2020
reviews.name: Are we there yet
reviews.title: Fun until My left Joy Con Died
