reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2020
reviews.name: Xandman
reviews.title: Mad at Nintendos poor customer/product support! Dont Buy A Nintendo!
reviews.review: Albeit, the games are good, and the family enjoys the use of it, as a parent I have HUGE ISSUES with the product!Although this is a cross portable/console gaming system, Nintendo fails to add basic theft deterrent measures:Example:1) There is no way to add a PIN to prevent unauthorized users from using your device. (All other game systems do! Xbox, PlayStation, Android and even the draconian Apple devices.)2) This device requires internet connection to configure it, and requires a internet connection from time to time for updates and other internal functions, yet, there is NO WAY FOR USERS TO TRACK THEIR DEVICE WHEN ITS LOST!So if your device is lost or stolen, too bad for you (us)!Besides that, there are other outrageous inconsistencies with the gaming standards!1) You may ONLY OWN 1 SWITCH. Once you link it to your Nintendo account, that is it!So if you have a family with 2-3 kids, you cannot buy a digital games once and family share, however all the other gaming platforms allow this!ie: Xbox, PlayStation, Google Play and even the draconian Apple.Also, Nintendo products (consoles and games) are almost never on sale. Although that is not a "defect" or "bug", its just a bad company practice and makes this system less appealing to parents who don't want (or need to) spend a small fortune with "games".I rather buy (and have done so) 3 XBoxs and everyone is playing together just fine.That, and the limited amount of cross-platform games Nintendo has to offer (only Fortnite & Minecraft) makes the Nintendo Switch a poor value for purchase and enjoyment.I recommend everyone NOT to buy Nintendo Switchs until their management fixes and addresses all of these issues.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2022
reviews.name: cheyanne
reviews.title: Nintendo Switch Console Review
reviews.review: I’ve owned my Nintendo Switch for three years, the games supplied for the Nintendo Switch never disappoint. The games are fun and interactive while also being able to be played with friends and family, this console and its games have brought much joy to nights in with friends and family. My friends and I find ourselves playing the Nintendo Switch for hours when we hang out and my family has game nights once a week where we like to enjoy Mario Party, Mario Kart, and other multiplayer games made for this console. The Nintendo Switch allows me to play old school games that I once enjoyed as a child, which bring nostalgic feelings. This console can last and be added onto by buying joy-cons and attachments for each game, the biggest pro for this console is the fact that it can be played alone or with others. Enjoying the new and old games on this console with friends and family is always a good time, when the Nintendo Switch is brought up everyone involved is ready to indulge in all the great selections they have for the console. One downfall for this system is that not all games from the past are yet available for the public to play, Nintendo slowly releases games for this console old and new. The only perk I could think of to fix this minor issue is having all old school games released when the Nintendo Switch was first released, this would allow more games to play that were once played by adults when they were children. I recommend this console to anyone who enjoys Nintendo games, it can bring a night together easily with friends and family. This console is very kid-friendly and also has a huge adult fan base, all games can be enjoyed by any age group and allow individuals to play the games they enjoy together.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2020
reviews.name: WillyD
reviews.title: Doesn’t connect to Spectrum WiFi
reviews.review: If you have Spectrum internet (and maybe others), then you cannot connect this console to the Internet.Its poorly-designed firmware says that the network requires registration (this would apply to most public WiFi networks such as what you’d find at Starbucks, where you need to accept some ToS before it will allow you to connect, but certainly doesn’t apply to my home internet connection, which works great for ANY device except the Nintendo Switch). From there, it directs you to login to the router admin (which there is no actual need to do). Once you have logged in, there is nothing to do except exit. After you exit, you will not be connected to the Internet.Would be a good console if it could connect to the Internet like literally every single other device in my home, including an old Windows Vista desktop, has no problem doing.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2020
reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Great product and love it to this day!
reviews.review: I’ve had my Nintendo Switch for about a year and half and I can definitely say I have not regretted that purchase since. Although I have the original version that has the shorter battery life, this shouldn’t take away from the review. I still have managed to seek hundreds of hours into all my games. As of right now I have 5 games which includes Super Smash Bros. Ultimate, Legend of Zelda Breath of the Wild, Super Mario Odyssey, Pokemon Sword, and Fire Emblem Three Houses. These are all great games to choose but I recommend Super Mario Odyssey as your first game of choice as it is super enjoyable for just about everyone. The Switch feels great in both handheld and TV mode. To summarize, the Nintendo Switch is an amazing product for not only hardcore Nintendo Fans but also for average person or family.But to get to why you should consider getting a Nintendo Switch, the first and most marketed reason is that you can both play it on your TV and on the go. When the Nintendo Switch goes to handheld mode, it experiences very little noticeable graphic drops. Being able to play your favorite games whenever you want is an amazing experience, especially with such high graphics compared to other handheld consoles. The second reason is that a lot of games with multiplayer, both first and third party, allow the Switches new joy-con controllers to be split into two controllers so two people can play at the same time without buying another controller. Some of the big games that are compatible with this are Super Smash Bros and Mario Kart, which are the Switches top 10 highest selling games. As for the third and final reason is that all first party games and most third-party games offer a great game play and an overall great experience to a game. The Switch even comes with a grip to hold both of them together and wrist strips for when they are separate. A small point to add is that the rest of Switch items, the two chords and dock are really easy to set-up and take anywhere. It’s made easier to carry them with the overabundance of Switch accessories everywhere.However, the Switch does have some minor downsides depending why you would buy a Switch. If you’re wanting something with the best graphic the Switch isn’t for you and you would be better off buying a PlayStation 4 or Xbox one. You do have to pay to be able to pay online, which I do have under a family pass. This is known as Nintendo online isn’t liked by many people as they don’t want to pay to play on online or dislike that they hide quality of life benefits through a pay wall. What Nintendo online also includes is cloud safe data for mostly only first party games, a complaint I have would be that this isn’t supported for all games including some first party ones. I feel that it is priced very well compared to other paid online usage in other consoles. It is priced at $19.99 a year, $4.99 a month, and if you can with a couple of friends pay a few amounts for the $34.99 family pass, which is still cheaper than a full year of PlayStation’s online service. Another benefit includes being able to play classic games from both the original NES and Super Nintendo. This extra service that comes with Nintendo online brings many games to play from those consoles and adds new ones every now and then. I feel like this is better than having to repurchase classic Nintendo games with every new console and just have them there. One last point to add is if you don’t really see yourself playing on the TV that much, the Nintendo Switch Lite is a great alternative as it is only to be used for portability.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2020
reviews.name: L Grayson
reviews.title: Device 5 stars, software and website zero stars
reviews.review: Cool toy and my child loves it. However, for a child to use it, you MUST make your own Nintendo account as well as a child account, download the app to set some parental controls, then use their website to set another round of parental controls. Really poorly designed and not intuitive. For example, when making an account, it allows you to use Google, Facebook etc instead of setting a unique Nintendo password. Convenient! However, you can’t buy anything without a parental password, so once you get father along and try to download something, they forgot about the Google sign in and you need to go back to the beginning and set up new Nintendo password for the parent. reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2019
reviews.name: A-LAWS
reviews.title: The best Nintendo Console yet
reviews.review: Switch’s big sell is its versatility. As I’ve already stated, it’s both a handheld and a home console. Its innards are powerful enough to deliver better-than-Wii U visuals, no matter where you happen to be. If you want to play The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild on the bus, you can. If you’d rather sit in front of your TV and sink your teeth into some competitive online Splatoon 2, you can do that too. Heck, if you fancy a two-player game of Mario Kart 8 Deluxe while sat in the park, I would be 100% behind that decision.Pro: It’s extremely flexible. The main selling point of Switch is its ability to transform from a home console to a portable gaming system in a snap. And on that front, it works as well as advertised. Transitioning from one style of gaming to another takes seconds and lets you continue playing right where you left off. A likely use-case is people who want to keep playing when their spouse/parent/roommate wants to watch something on the TVCon: Unfortunately, the Switch’s internal memory is just as small as the hardware’s footprint, which, if you’re planning on buying most of your games digitally, is going to be a sizable headache. The system has just 32GB of internal storage, some of which is reserved for the operating system

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2020

reviews.title: Whats wrong with my switch
reviews.review: My son had his switch for about over a year now and has so many problems with it already1) First of both joycons have jostick drift for whatever reason which makes it harder and less fun to play on2) Both Joyons Sl/SR buttons dont work at all neither does the small dot in between the joycon work when im trying to sync to another switch.3) My contollers randomly disconnect from the switch without me holding the button to slide it out which Interruptsmy gameplay4) On my Red joycon to R button works on and Off sometimes i have to press it more aggressivelyfor it to activate.5) I was playing super smash bros and i decided I want to play with my contollers disconnected form the switch so i toke them out and all of a sudden my left blue joycon doesnt work at all it wouldnt turn on or activate even if i put it back onto the switch. Ihave looked up ways to try to fix this i have cleaned my contoller but nothing is working and im so frustrated. I have about 10 games on my switch which now im unable to play.I will show pictures or videos if necessaryIf any nintendo employee sees this i will gratefully appreciate if i canrequest for a new joycons or a new switch.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2020
reviews.name: DtheStampede
reviews.title: Love my Switch!
reviews.review: One thing to note is that I bought it going on two years back so it's not one with the 4.5 to 9 hour battery life when in hand-held mode. On the other hand, I got it for the actual retail price of $299.99 so I have no real reason to complain about it's battery life, especially when I usually have it docked and am playing on my T.V.It also has a ton of great games, both first and third party, big developer and indie developer. one thing though, you're going to want a micro SD card with a lot of space if buying a lot of digital games like i did because the Switch has only 32 GB internal memory.There is also the matter of the Switch Online Service which is $20 a year for the individual plan, but seeing as the competition is charging twice that, not a big deal breaker to me.Now a list of games to try:Get 10 Quest-a great little indie puzzle game available digitally for $4Tetris 99-A classic puzzle game turned into a battle with 98 other players. was free to start, but $10 for DLC.Hollow Knight-Excellent but hard metroidvaina game that is a better deal digitally than physical copy. $20/$34Super Mario Odyssey-it's a Mario game. -shrugs-Dragon Quest XI-Great JRGP.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2019
reviews.name: L. Walker
reviews.title: Most played gaming device... says it all
reviews.review: You don't need a long review for this one. I have a dedicated gaming PC, the newest iterations of Xbox and PS, and Switch. The amount of time spent with the Switch dwarfs the others, with the gaming PC coming in a distant second. I see no need to purchase Xbox / PS consoles moving forward as they are fully redundant / less robust in comparison to the gaming PC. The Switch, with its portability, occupies a different niche. But more importantly, the standout games it does have are what makes the difference. I put more hours into Fire Emblem: Three Houses in 1 month than I have played my PS in its lifetime. Breath of the Wild was a spectacular introduction to the system.This is the console to own if you are going to have a console.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2021
reviews.name: spider-man
reviews.title: These gaming consoles are ridiculous these days.
reviews.review: Why on earth would you want or need Plugable Ethernet Adapters: USB 2.0 vs. USB 3.0 vs. USB-C when Nintendo only supports USB 2.0 in the first place? This is freaking stupid! The Nintendo Switch it's self is wireless lol meaning it supports WI-FI. The additional remotes that you can buy aka controllers are so cheaply made and the dock is also made from cheap plastic parts. You drop this thing once and trust me it's gonna break into a million pieces. The games are so over priced and they are literally installed on some sort of SD card...., Really!? The memory is stored on an additional microSD and microSDXC cards, and has 32GB of internal NAND memory. So be prepared to buy more memory. The HDMI cable the console comes with is literally a cheap $3 dollar cable you can buy at Walmart lol. Where is Mike Tyson's Punch out in 3D new and improved? Why is this console NOT backwards compatible? Why have an internal USB 3.0 port but only supports 2.0? Are you freaking kidding me!? No software updates? No additional upgrades? Mario Galaxy 1 and 2 should of been on the same game! Super Mario 64 should of been in widescreen HD! We should be able to play all our old Mario, Zelda and punch-out games on this console in 3D renewed!~ Yes the only games worth playing are the Mario Franchised ones and of course Zelda's breath of the wild. Nintendo has officially ripped people off during a national pandemic. We thought you wanted our business ....

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2020
reviews.name: Aaron
reviews.title: Only good for a year
reviews.review: Our switch was a Christmas gift to my kids last Christmas. We have only allowed the kids to use it on weekends and during holidays.Almost one year after opening it, it will not power on any more. We never use it off the dock so it is not a dead battery.I followed the instructions from Nintendo support for doing a hard reset and still no change.The only step left is to send it to nintendo for repairs and who knows how long it will sit on their shelf before they finally get around to looking at it.Use your money on a playstation or xbox.

reviews.title: Common issue of Wi-fi connection breaking
reviews.review: I love the Switch as a console but after about a year or so, it completely stopped connecting or even detecting any nearby wifi signals. I researched, and tried all the troubleshooting you could think of. It seems to be a common issue with these consoles. I have had to order an Ethernet adapter in order to play games because of updates, etc. Great console but thats a pretty huge issue.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2019
reviews.name: ordrune
reviews.title: Frustrating Hardware Issues and Poor Customer Service
reviews.review: The hardware is pretty under powered and to a noticeable extent on some games; slowdowns where they stop responding to input for a couple seconds.My big issue is the horrible joy-con controls.I have been having issues where the wrist strap modules won't stay connected to the joy-con and slide off or they get stuck and have to be forced off.Each of my modules behaves in one of those two ways, although the one that slides off may be because the other needs to be forced off.Went though customer support and still having issue with "fixed" modules.Can't find a way to contact support directly, only automated contact through web site.Joy-cons also seem to randomly disconnect and reconnect while playing causing loss of control in game.Poorly designed and frustrating system.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2020
reviews.name: Len Truelsen
reviews.title: Price gouging is becoming a huge issue
reviews.review: Nintendo and Amazon need to do something about this price gouging, yesterday. Preorders for new switch stock have started to become available on here over the past few days, and yet it's all been sold out within a minute or two, likely because of bots people have written to buy it up. That's completely unacceptable, and Nintendo is a large company with enough resources to at least pressure Amazon into a solution if they're not going to do something about it themselves. If they don't work this out soon, it's going to be even worse once productivity is back up to normal.

reviews.title: Best Console for on the Go
reviews.review: ProsEasy to pack up and take anywhere you goSmall physical games for easy travelWide variety of custom controllers, cases, and skinsConsJoy-Cons can wear down and start to drift after a short timeShorter battery life when playing on the go on demanding gamesLower graphics and FPSOverall the Nintendo Switch is a solid choice for those who don’t focus too much on graphic quality and want a system that can handle most games today with the added benefit of being able to play on the go anywhere.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2020
reviews.name: Matt Hubbard
reviews.title: Beware of this system
reviews.review: The console was fun and my son loved it when he got it for Christmas. We really enjoyed it for the month that it worked.We opened the system on Christmas day and it stopped working on January 24. There was no damage done to it, no drops, no spills, nothing. My son tried to start Pokemon Shield and the system crashed and displayed an error message. Then the screen went black and it would never turn back on.When calling Nintendo customer service I was told repeatedly that they think it was mishandled or dropped and that caused the damage. Finally they agreed to honor the 1 year warranty and repair it after assuring them multiple times that the console was not abused. Remember that the system did not even male it 1 month without breaking. After voicing concerns I was assured that we would not lose our saved data. Today I was notified that the system has been repaired and we lost all of our saved data. The internal power supply crapped out and they don't know why.I highly recommend not buying this system. It has caused a lot of unhappiness in our house and we still have never been given an explanation as to what caused the problem. Spend your hard earned money on a higher quality system. You and your family deserve better than this cheaply made, overpriced, and poorly supported console.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2019
reviews.name: Mike
reviews.title: Better than the first version by a mile.
reviews.review: I use to not mind the battery of the original switch until recently. Playing witcher 3 drained the battery in about 2 hours on my old switch and it was annoying. So I decided to trade in my old one and pay the difference for a new one. Now I'm getting over 4 hours playing it at a time in handheld mode. The system runs cooler as well and isn't as warm. Only thing that sucked was having to redownload all of my games and cloud saves but that didn't take long. Overall happy with the upgrade.

Want to play original NES games? first youve got to create another acct. The family acct for Switch Online is $36/yr (watch the auto-renewal!) and there are very few games to choose from. I'm sure by the time they actually add the games I'd enjoy, they will discontinue the network like they did with the last Nintendo online network. Wish the corporate executives would just let people pay once for a game, then play the game without making you create 10 passwords you will never remember and pay for "services" that you'll never enjoy. What a total ripoff. Nintendo, I wish you ill.

reviews.review: Had the switch for almost two years now, but all of a sudden I set it down one day and the LCD starts to act up and a visual bug starts to darken the entire screen, while being able to see all the pages you last visited. (While playing games I can see the Home Screen in the background still) This is all not even including I have owned 4 joycons that all drift because no matter how many times you send the drifting joycons to Nintendo to fix they always come back just as broken as before. The switch has a very limited memory pool depending on what you’re purchasing, so it’s much easier to give in and purchase the game cards. The games are excellent from Nintendo and are always enjoyable! But sadly poor hardware and a terrible, cheap, and underdeveloped system severely limit their maximum enjoyment and potential.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2020
reviews.name: Amy Williams
reviews.title: There is a bid hole in their parental controls
reviews.review: Once you link a console profile to a Nintendo account, it cannot be unlinked without deleting the profile.This means that your child can link his or her profile to a parental account and bypass parental controls.As there is no way to transfer game information or purchases between profiles, I'm face with a deciding between letting my 10-year old have full parental access and purchase abilities through my account or deleting his profile, causing him to lose all of his purchases and game information.This is a serious flaw in both the parental controls and the product design.Nintendo's stance is that there is a warning about this on the console.That doesn't help when a child is the one responding.I should have bought an X-Box instead.

reviews.review: Everything about this device is brilliant. The design, build quality, functionality etc... I absolutely love it. What is not great about it (right now), is the price. A few selfish people are buying them all, and reselling them for great profits. There is still a way though, to get them for what they're worth. There is this website called "Stock Informer" which I used recently to buy my Switch; it notifies you when new stock or pre-orders are available on Amazon for market resale price ($300). Usually the stock disappears within five minutes, so you have to be fast.

Nintendo wants me to send it in for repairs, leaving my son with no switch for an undetermined amount of time. Amazon will send a replacement February 2nd. Which is more than a month.I am wondering when did it ever become acceptable to pay for a toy (that cost more than my car payment) only to have it not work, or wait not days, weeks, but more than a month later.This sucks on all levels. Amazon & Nintendo gets Rotten tomatoes from me!

reviews.title: I'm in tears
reviews.review: I ordered this console and a gift, this is what arrived. See what's missing?????THE CONSOLE AND CONTROLLERS!! I'm glad my children didn't know it was supposed to be coming, I feel absolutely sick to my stomach. I hope the person that did this.....well... it's not really appropriate to type for the public to read. If this is the serial number on your console, may you lose every game and develop carpal tunnel.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2021
reviews.name: Misty
reviews.title: Works Like A Charm, Glad I Pre-Ordered
reviews.review: Around the time everyone got their money, I had been searching for a Nintendo Switch.Me and someone else chipped in and started lurking the net.We searched everywhere!Target, Walmart, BestBuy, and even GameStop.No body had any Nintendo Switches in and some people was jacking the prices even higher as they was a bulk buyer.We had been heart broken, we was unsure when they would ever update or even announce the next re-stock.Fortunately for us, Amazon had allowed you to be able to pre-order the next stock.So I did.The shipment came faster then expected and cheaper then any store really had sold it for.The package was lovely, just as pictured, and nothing was scratched or broken.Nor was anything of the sort missing, all had been given.The Switch itself runs perfectly and the gameplay is very high quality.The buttons and sticks do not get stuck and are easy to press on.Everything is easy to use and to navigate as a newbie.I would highly recommend this product. ^^

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2021
reviews.name: Bridges Gijsbers
reviews.title: Best in gaming systems
reviews.review: All the other brands need to bow down to this design. By far the best. The kickstand enabling on the go play with detached remotes. Being able to use it as a mobile gaming system with joycons (controllers) attached. Then dock it and being able to play on the TV. The two joycons can be used for two person play, basically one controller set can be used as two controllers for some games. Sure it doesn't have the horsepower to play the super high graphics high frame rate games, but the family friendly selections, and classics like Zelda, Mario, Mariokart, etc, plus download content and free SNES games you get with your nintendo subscription is just wild. Absolute best in entertainment.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2020
reviews.name: James Meehan
reviews.title: A+++++++
reviews.review: Just received it today( one day earlier then was told so that's a plus) took it out and plugged it in. My 8yr old daughter hasn't put it down since. And for all the people wondering and asking it is the newer model with the longer battery life, yes it is the one with the longer battery life so buy it now because no ones selling the new ones just very few and they’re going fast

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2022
reviews.name: Cherokee Chick
reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.review: My young-adult daughter kept telling me how much fun she and her husband have with their Switch. So my husband and I decided to get one to go with our Xbox One. We love it! It doesn’t matter if you’re a kid or an over 50 adult, there are some great games that bring back lots of great memories from previous systems. It’s worth the money, especially if you can’t go out as much as you did before Covid. I will say that raising the price 200$ in November, to gauge people for Christmas was pretty crappy. I’m glad we waited to get ours at the regular price.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2020
reviews.name: Julia
reviews.title: Love it!
reviews.review: Bought for my son’s birthday! Great video game console. It is very small and light which makes it very portable. The screen isn't too small, but just right to be able to use it without problem. The resolution of the screen itself is a little low, 720p, but when it is connected to a TV or monitor it outputs at 1080p. The system is rugged and well built and we have no problems with it when it comes to its hardware. It is very comfortable in the hand and we have no problem playing with it for a long periods of time. The battery is also great. It lasts him hours of playtime without problem and is great for commutes.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2020
reviews.name: lynnrobin
reviews.title: Good console with some problems
reviews.review: I love the switch, I however do not like the fact that on my switch and my daughters switch the joysticks stop working so easily. I had to replace her left one & my right one is starting to act up. I have recalibrated them so that’s not the issue & I’m not rough with it, it’s just that they aren’t made Well. I haven’t even owned mine 2 months.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2020
reviews.name: Pope Fred
reviews.title: Great system for the Mario lover and more
reviews.review: Great casual gaming. I suggest hunting down the physical disks over utilizing the Nintendo store if she'd like to maximize your dollar value in a long run. If you have large hands I'd also suggest getting a remote control that fits your hands. I like that the switch has so many options available of controllers. all of the players in my house have been able to find forms that are comfortable for them. As a huge Mario fan there's no other place for me to get these titles. the biggest hit on the system is that many of the streaming services do not have applications or programs available at this time which is just strange to me.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2020
reviews.name: AmparoNieto
reviews.title: Essential for 2020
reviews.review: Originally bought this for my brother but as the pandemic hit, I am “stuck” with it until I get to see him. I have never used any portable console before but I love this one, it seems too fragile though so I’m looking into see if there are any cases for it. Won’t regret buying it, specially during these times!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2020
reviews.name: General Polaris
reviews.title: STOP OVERCHARGING FOR SWITCHES
reviews.review: The console arrived quicker then expected, everything was in great shape. My only gripe is that all these sellers are scalping hard for switches everywhere. I understand its business, but this is low for all sellers on this site. How long can you expect to keep this going? The console itself is an amazing thing, but a near $500 upmarket price is not what its worth, bottom line.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2020
reviews.name: Shelley Iverson
reviews.title: Granny Gamer LOVES Switch!
reviews.review: I am a 68 year old grandmother!Love my Switch!My son bought it for me as a Christmas gift!I am finding that it helps my memory as well as eye-hand coordination!LOL!Love playing video games!Zelda is my favorite!You are never to old to have fun!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2022
reviews.name: Alekzandria Latimer
reviews.title: Nintendo
reviews.review: Giving a 3 star review it came early and already wiped and everything looked and seemed like it was in working order. It is a gift so we will see how it is in the next couple days c:I will update based on how it is. It was kind of funny cause there were stickers that came on it they were pokemon I felt bad wasting them but my boyfriend is 22 and not a pokemon fan so I peeled them off, luckily there was no sticky scraps stuck to it and I didn't have to struggle cleaning it after wards 💕

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2021
reviews.name: Noah Devaux
reviews.title: Nothing bad to say(ExclusivesDirect)
reviews.review: I’m not even going to lie, I’ve seen plenty off reviews on this saying it’s bad but most of them are people who misunderstood what they bought or were expecting way too much. If your looking for a console you can play anywhere and still have a solid experience this is the end of searches. 20 dollars for a year of online use? That’s a steal, with exclusivesDirect I saved 70 dollars and now that money can buy me some games. Overall this is who it’s for: if your moving constantly, don’t have a lot of time to play, don’t want to hassle with wires, don’t mind low Quailty gameplay with the upside of play anywhere in the world at any time, and want a solid experience with exclusive games this is for you. The reason I mentioned ExclusivesDirect is because they are selling theirs for 230$ and it looks brand new original everything and no scratches or damage, I would highly highly highly recommend them.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2020
reviews.name: WeHoRey
reviews.title: Of course it's great!
reviews.review: It's a new Nintendo Switch and it works as expected. About the only issue I do have is I realized after purchase (a week later) that I didn't add the extended electronics warranty from Amazon and when I contacted them to see how to purchase it they gave me no answer. Would really REALLY like to add some sort of warranty option on my unit but can't seem to get answer from anyone. But the unit's great!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2020
reviews.name: Carolyn Wang
reviews.title: Perfect for all gamers
reviews.review: The perfect console for all ages. Having grown up with Nintendo consoles, this system brings back my fondest memories with an innovative twist. I love the “switch” capability of being able to pick up the console right from the dock without interrupting the gameplay. There are so many fantastic titles exclusive to the Switch, which makes for many hours of nonstop enjoyment. This is one of Nintendo’s best systems yet, and I’m excited for what’s to come next.

reviews.title: Husband LOVES it
reviews.review: Let's just admit you can't really go wrong with Nintendo. My husband loved the colors, loved the way he could play with a single large controller or smaller one, and he appreciated that I had the foresight to purchase the one that offered extended battery life.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2021

reviews.title: Panned out in our favor
reviews.review: The package came about 1.5 weeks early, which was great. I’ve seen some of the reviews and was a little nervous, but I took the risk knowing I could just return it for a full refund worst case scenario. It was a birthday gift for my boyfriend and he’s been playing it for a week straight with no issues and the quality is fantastic. I checked the ID on the switch to make sure we were sold the newest version and not the old model as well. Overall, worth the risk and it’s awesome!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2021

reviews.title: Overpriced Console
reviews.review: Purchased this console for on the go gaming. The amount of software glitches with this console is unacceptable I learned too late that this also need an additional SD for storage. That purchase was made only to have a fault SD port. A lot of money wasted, returned because I couldnt deal with the headache anymore. When it did work, the games were fun.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2020
reviews.name: HongDing
reviews.title: Long Shipping Waiting Period. Expensive Value
reviews.review: I have been tracking on this V2 Second Generation Switch for at least six months. I have been trying to find all kind of sources but it seems lots buyers try to stock them and resell in higher value. Maybe amazon and other platforms can only allow one buyer with one product only through their ID. Waiting period was not accurate since it shows will be arrived in October thus the delivery period is not accurate and unorganized timing.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2020
reviews.name: sarasarasara
reviews.title: Solid console for handheld or couch gaming
reviews.review: I purchased this Switch as a gift but have had one myself for a while. I generally play it in handheld mode but will occasionally use the dock to connect it to the TV. There is a wide range of games available in the eshop as well as physical titles. The battery life is great (generally 6 or so hours depending on the type of game). The Switch has been exactly what I'd expect from a Nintendo console. Overall, I am very happy with my purchase.

Eso sí, he tenido que instalar el control parental por que si no se corre todo el día jugando. La consola no es barata, su precio es algo elevado pero es de gran calidad.

We also got the Ring Adventure Fit game and we are getting really good workouts with it! The controls work great and it was easy to use and set up.

reviews.review: This thing is probably the most fun console out there. Graphics still lag behind Sony and Microsoft but this thing is fun and the portability is beyond cool. We would recommend it to anyone looking for an all around fun console with a good game selection.

reviews.review: Love this system for several reasons. The entire family can play or the kids can take turns using it as a one person device. Games have good graphics and there are games for everyone not matter the style you like to play.

reviews.review: Got this for my kid since he loves Pokemon, which is exclusive to Nintendo. The hardware is very well designed. This costs similar to PS4, but the graphics is sub par. Overall expensive for what it offers compared to other gaming consoles.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2021

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2020

reviews.review: I was skeptical at first because it's been so hard to find a seller that isn't scamming people or price gouging. The price was okay and everything works so far. My wife is very happy with her birthday gift, no complaints yet.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2021

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2019

reviews.title: Great product
reviews.review: I got this for my son it works great he loves it. Everything is working fine. We hooked it up to tv it’s working perfect. The only problem is he wants more games and they are not cheap lol be prepared to buy games.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2019

reviews.review: Great!Love this console.You can take it on the go or play it on the television.The available games suit my 8 yr old daughter.Mario party is one of our favorites.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2022

reviews.review: I know that this is not a full blow console compared other consoles like ps4 or Xbox, but damn the games are expensive too. Why should I pay $60 for a game?

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2021
reviews.name: kevin
reviews.title: Amazon warehouse steal !
reviews.review: Came up on a deal from the warehouse saved me over 100buckswarehouse said there was an imperfection on-top of the item and it was actually brand new with not a single scratch

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2020
reviews.name: Roland Guinn
reviews.title: Kids love it
reviews.review: Nintendo did it again. I remember as a child drooling over acquiring the new Nintendo systems and its no surprise my children are the same way. 300 for this system is a steal as they can take it on the go or plug and and have fun together on the bug screen in our living room. Occupies their entire days and I love it, perfect little gift for the kids during quarantine.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2020
reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Ripoff
reviews.review: I received the discontinued Switch for twice the cost of the new one. When I opened the box the controller mount already had a gouge in it, the joycons thumb sticks do not sit in their proper position so the character in the games you play are always moving when you do not want them to, and to top it all off the system over heats within 10min of use. I did my research and moved it to an open air location and even at one point had a floor fan pointed directly at it with no success. Do not buy this product.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2021
reviews.name: TayTheBuyer
reviews.title: Unplayable Mine must be defective
reviews.review: The media could not be loaded. Absolutely terrible input delay is so noticable unable to play and the nintendo switch itself drops frames and is terrible would not recommend until pro comes out

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2020
reviews.name: CAM
reviews.title: Excellent video game console that’s portable.
reviews.review: Awesome video game console that connects to the TV but that can also be portable. All you gotta do is pull the screen out of the dock which is connected to the tv via HDMI. MARIO KART is the best game!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2021
reviews.name: MGD
reviews.title: Just get it already
reviews.review: Not for hardcore gamers but it’s definitely for everyone else. Great selection of games and been portable is a great idea when you want to avoid talking to people.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2020

reviews.title: Grandsons love it.
reviews.review: It’s not cheap but it served well as the sole present for my grandsons ages 5 and 7.It also promotes them working together instead of arguing.All in all a good gift.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2020

reviews.review: Stuck inside due to COVID-19? Get a switch and countless hours turn into days turn into weeks turn into months and alas you will be playing beautiful games on your switch and watching as capitalism falls down as you're subservient to a raccoon. Alas the wonderful world we live in

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2021

reviews.title: Camping essential
reviews.review: Got this for my husband so he doesn't use up all our data on our phones when we go camping.Now if we could only figure out how to play all the games we also got to go with it.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2021

At home possibility to dock console and play like a classic console is convenient.Especially Switch good forfans of anime because there is a lot games based on popular anime titles such as Fate, Pokémon.Good choice.

reviews.review: This product was very easy to unbox. I only wish I had purchased a game to go with it.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2020
reviews.name: Ryan H
reviews.title: Amazing Product... With Some Drawbacks
reviews.review: The Nintendo Switch is, by all means an amazing... and perhaps my favorite "console" from Nintendo thus far: it has amazing games and the portability is a huge bonus! But it's not void of some major drawbacks, and I wouldn't recommend paying more than $300 for it... as by that point it's simply not worth it.It comes with the Switch console, an HDMI cable, a USB-C + A/C charger, two wrist straps which the controllers mount to, a mount that turns the two side-controllers into a standalone controller, and finally a system mounting station: where you can plug in things like the HDMI cord, the charging cable, etc. and simply mount your Switch at any time for "wireless" charging (similar to a wireless charging mount on a phone).Now, here's the problems and why I wouldn't pay more than $299 for it:1) The battery is absolutely terrible. On a full 100% charge, unless you set the brightness to less than 75% it will last maybe a whopping 3-4 hours. And setting the brightness below 75% just looks... awful and dim. By modern standards this just isn't great... as my cell phone, which packs more horsepower than the Switch, easily lasts 15 hours on a full charge. The Switch does not. It also takes quite a long time to charge, so there's no fast-charging.2) The display resolution isn't great by modern standards. While it's not bad, you would think a current-gen console would have at least UHD or WQHD. It doesn't, and the most you can get out of it, even when hooked to an external display is 1080p.3) The speakers are simply not good. Turned all the way up to max volume, you will still barely be able to hear this if you're sitting next to a fan or a window A/C unit. In other words, it's hard to hear unless you're sitting in a silent room. It also sounds like you're sitting in a can. It does have a 3.5mm aux for headphones, so that's a bonus.4) The USB-C charging port is placed on the bottom of the Switch, rendering any stand or mount useless while it's plugged in. This is a poor design choice, since if you want to play with the Switch plugged in (which you'll often need to do, thanks to the poor battery), you will have to either hold it or lay it flat on its back. The stand is non-functional when plugged in, and the same will apply to any external stands or cases w/ grips.5) Not compatible with wireless headphones or other Bluetooth devices unless you buy an adapter. This is another huge disappointment, especially when considering the speakers aren't great... because Bluetooth headphones/earbuds won't work with the Switch out of the box. Thankfully you can find an adapter for it though... but it'll cost you another $40.If you can get past these major issues, which in my opinion are pretty disappointing for a current generation console from one of the biggest gaming companies in the world, then yes: I absolutely, 100% recommend the Switch as it's a unique and innovative little console with amazing exclusive games. It also has some bonuses: it looks really cool, it's modular, it can be played handheld or on a TV, there's great exclusives from Nintendo, it has plenty of built-in storage and the option to add an SD-Card, it uses USB-C, and more.Yet for the issues and drawbacks, I can't recommend paying more than $300 for it, and I wouldn't rate this higher than a 4.2 out of 5.0.

reviews.title: Finally got one
reviews.review: So who's kids haven't been talking about this device, my kids wanted once since Christmas. Finally got it and they couldn't be happier, need too of course. I made an account and even bought a case for it before I received it. I just wanted to make sure it stays protected.So far we have 6 games( mario kart, cars, some cave man game and a Zelda game) also bought 4 extra controllers for when my kids cousins come by.So far it has been great, keeps the kids busy and I can't lie, I like to play too.The fact that it's portable and easy to connect to any TV is great, plus you can add more controllers Wich keeps the kids from fighting for a turn.If you are lucky enough to get one, try it out, it's been too much fun so far. It's a great replacement from our Nintendo Wii U.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2022
reviews.name: TooFLy
reviews.title: First console in over 20 years...
reviews.review: I used to play games back in the eighties and the nineties, but then I grew up and grew out of it. Now I wanted something that would help me to exercise. So I decided to get this so I could work out. I really like it. I've also played a lot of different games there are not exercise games and I like those too. I think this is a good value for the money. If you want to stay active and don't just like to play regular video games, this is a great option to get you off of the couch.
